Content:: The Fourth Gotabaya Rajapaksa cabinet, also known as the Rajapaksa-Wickremesinghe cabinet, was the central government of Sri Lanka led by President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. It was formed on 12 May 2022 after the appointment of Ranil Wickremesinghe as the new Prime Minister[1] and ended on 13 July 2022, after Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country and appointed Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe as acting President of Sri Lanka. This is the 6th time Wickremesinghe has served as Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, a world record.[2][3] Ministers appointed under article 43(1) of the constitution.
